data.description:
It's time for smart jewellery.

They say diamonds are a girl's best friend, so now you can carry around this huge virtual diamond. Your Pebble Time Round will display this glorious 2cm of sparkling beauty, with a small clock in the center so that you can still know what time it is now. And of course it will shine even brighter with your backlight on!

And if your outfit calls for a different gem color, you have options! We also have available: aquamarine, sapphire, emerald, pink quartz, amethyst, ruby, and topaz.

It looks particularly good if you attach your Pebble to a chain to use it as a necklace. Visit our website to buy the necklace adapter kit.

The perfect jewellery for the connected woman.

latest_release.release_notes: Update color instantaneously when gem settings are changed

First release of Pagan watchface.

data.description:
Displays date, time, current astrological sun sign, a graphical depiction of the lunar phase and the planet-based day of the week. On solstices, equinoxes and cross-quarter days, the planetary day of the week display is replaced with the name of the festival associated with the day(s) as follows:

Feb 2: Imbolc
Mar 20-22: Ostara (Vernal Equinox)
May 1: Beltane
June 20-22: Litha (Summer Solstice)
Aug 1: Lughnasadh
Sep 20-22: Mabon (Autumnal Equinox)
Oct 31: Samhain
Dec 20-22: Yule (Winter Solstice)

Bluetooth connection status and battery percentage are also displayed.

latest_release.release_notes: Added color for compatible watchfaces and combined bitmaps using tags.

data.author: Peter Wiesner
data.description:
Almost the simplest Watchface available! You can find the time in the middle (only 24h format supported, this is part of the "design"). You can read different informations below the time depending on the hour:
 - from 22 till morning 7, you can read the battery so you can decide, whether to charge Pebble or not before you are going to sleep or leave the house
 - between 7-8, between 12-13 and between 18-22, you will find the current date in "yyyy MMM dd" format as this time is spent with moving from home to work, this can be useful in these hours
 - in the rest of the day, the weekday, the current date and the state of battery information is rotated in every minute

This distribution is currently for experiment. Later on you should be able to set these from the settings.

Supported language: English
data.title: SiliconSampler

data.description:
Analog watchface based on the "Observable universe logarithmic illustration" by Pablo Carlos Budassi.  Pablo has given me permission to use the image.

The universe image rotates around with the bright white center of the Milky Way galaxy at the normal analog hour position.   The current minute is the last tick mark around the universe image.

Screenshots show: 11:57, 3:15, 6:05, 9:16

Pablo's amazing image is described as a "logarithmic scale conception of the observable universe with the Solar System at the center, inner and outer planets, Kuiper belt, Oort cloud, Alpha Centauri, Perseus Arm, Milky Way galaxy, Andromeda galaxy, nearby galaxies, Cosmic Web, Cosmic microwave radiation and Big Bang's invisible plasma on the edge."   
Check it out by following the website link.
 

Watchface Design & Programming Copyright ¬© 2016 Nev Rawlins

latest_release.release_notes: Added support for Quick Views

data.title: Universe

changelog.release_notes:
- Renamed to AWW1 (Analog Weather Watch 1). There will soon be a AWW2 watch face, witch supports the new SDK4 features. This version will stay available for people who didn't (want to) update their Pebbles to an SDK4 version.
- Error notifications (e.g. missing API key or location) should be less frequent now.
- Basic support of the new Pebble 2 (Timeline Quick View should work with the watch face partially hidden behind it, full support will come with AWW2).
bigger font for temperature if no update time is displayed
new: weather alerts for US
bug fix, next attempt - please tell me if the "API Key needed" problem persists.

bug fix (hopefully): "API Key needed" alert was shown frequently. If the problem continues, please tell me. The problem didn't occur on my own Pebble (connected to an Android phone), so I am not sure, if it is successfully fixed.

- bug fixes
- new: weather alerts for Europe (configurable)
modified: color white is replaced by gray within the weather icons if background color is set to white
bug fix: text color was accidentally reset to default
new: a tap puts weather info in the front for 10 seconds (in case something is hidden behind the hands)
bug fix: location wasn't updated correctly

- new: option to display current temperature
- bug fixes
bug fixes

New options on settings page:
- vibrate on disconnect / reconnect
- invert colors to indicate bluetooth disconnect (Original Pebble / Pebble Steel)

data.description:
Customizable analog watchface with hourly weather forecast.

- Uses Weather Underground
- Location via GPS or manual input of latitude and longitude
- Customizable colors and display options
- Battery indicator: the gap within the ring in the center moves depending on the charge state
- Minute hand color changes on Bluetooth connect / disconnect (configurable)
- Shows weather forecast for the next 12 hours as icons near the hour markers (always shows the forecast, e.g. as soon as it is 8 am the forecast for 8 pm is shown)
- Shows moon phase within the icons

latest_release.release_notes:
- Renamed to AWW1 (Analog Weather Watch 1). There will soon be a AWW2 watch face, witch supports the new SDK4 features. This version will stay available for people who didn't (want to) update their Pebbles to an SDK4 version.
- Error notifications (e.g. missing API key or location) should be less frequent now.
- Basic support of the new Pebble 2 (Timeline Quick View should work with the watch face partially hidden behind it, full support will come with AWW2).

data.title: AWW1 - Analog WeatherWatch

data.author: Fine Faces

changelog.release_notes:
Version 2.1:

Added an option to disable shake-for-date.  Also, there is now a delay of 2 seconds before the watch shows the date, so you can check the time as well when you shake your wrist.

Version 2.0

Labels now pop up at the top of the screen if you're low on battery or you've lost your Bluetooth connection.

Also!  Introducing AccuFuzzyTime - in 'Fuzzy Time' mode, the watch is still sort of fuzzy, but if we're just before a time (say 15:14) it'll report it as 'Almost quarter past 3', and just after the time (say 15:16) it says 'About quarter past 3'.  It's still reluctant to be pinned down to an actual time, but it's a bit more honest now.

24/01/16 - Version 1.71:

I messed up shake-for-date on monochrome Pebbles after that last update, but now it is fixed.

24/01/16 - Version 1.7:

Fixed a problem with longer Italian numbers not fitting on the 4th line properly when using a round watch.  It's a niche case but it's fixed now so that should be good.

Fixed it so you can now choose different colours for the background, labels and text on colour Pebbles.  Hey!  It looks much better now!

22/01/16 - Version 1.6:

Implemented 'shake-for-date' - give your wrist a jolt and you'll know the date!  Goes back to time display after 10 seconds.

Added an option for 'fuzzy time' - the watch will display the time to the nearest five minutes, but will adjust its language appropriately when it's not being 100% accurate.

19/01/2016 - Version 1.5:

Altered the Italian version so shorter words are displayed in the larger font.  Looks better like that.

Version 1.4: 18/01/15

Somebody emailed me to ask if I could translate the watchface into Italian.  I'd never considered that before but thought that it might be interesting.  So, the watchface is now available in Italian!

12th January 2016 - Version 1.3:

Now available on Pebble Time Round.
Added the ability to choose the alignment of the labels - choose between left, right, centred and random.
Users of colour Pebbles can select their own colours for the background and the labels.

8th January 2016 - Version 1.2:  

Added a configuration screen - allows users of black & white Pebbles to choose to invert the colours.  

The next update will allow users of colour Pebbles to pick their own colours! Imagine that!

Version 1.1:

Now includes support for Pebble Time watches.  
Uses a bolder font to allow for greater legibility.  
Has black space between each line so it looks more like labels, and less like a giant block of text.

data.description:
A watchface which displays the time in natural language, mimicking the appearance of printable sticky labels. Has low battery/bluetooth notifications.

Including: Shake for date! 'Fuzzy time' option! Tells the time in English or Italian! Customizable colours! Left/right/centred/random alignment!

(Currently in the English or Italian languages only.)

If you like the watchface please let me know how you'd like it to develop!

latest_release.release_notes:
Version 2.1:

Added an option to disable shake-for-date.  Also, there is now a delay of 2 seconds before the watch shows the date, so you can check the time as well when you shake your wrist.

data.description:
Modeled after the first LED Wrist Time Computer, this face will tell the time more accurately then an astrological pulsar. Its 18k Gold face will be attractive for all kinds of people. Advantages are no moving parts, no hands, gears, dials, or maintenance needed. A miniature computer, telling the time. Perfect for 1972.

Yes, that was a pun.

Just like the original, you get the time. It will either be displayed as 12 or 24 hour depending on your pebble's settings. You will also have notification on when there is no connection.

Purchase a license for 99 cents to unlock additional features!

Additional features include:

Battery Meter with charging indicator!
Flick for the date, then flick back again for time!
See the temperature and conditions outside!
Now with Fahrenheit!

But wait, there's more!

This new update now gives you color options!
Choose from Red, Green, or Blue glass LEDs!
You can even change the case from gold to sexy stainless steel. 

Thank you!

latest_release.release_notes:
v1.2
Fix temp format settings
Add new color options!

data.title: Time Computer

data.description:
Binary version of my ‚ÄòStars‚Äô watchface.

I couldn‚Äôt resist the name, normally used for a system of two stars where one star revolves round the other or both revolve round a common center. 

As on ‚ÄòStars‚Äô, larger (blue) stars are for hours and smaller (orange) for minutes.

Two modes:

Easy: 
Hours on the left and minutes on the right.  
Hours -  11th hour on analog=1, 10th=2, 8th=4, 7th=8
Minutes - 5th minute on analog=1, 10th=2, 15th=4, 20th=8, 25th=16, 30th=32

Hard:
Hours every third hour and minutes every 10th, so mixed and therefore harder to read.
Hours -  12th hour on analog=1, 3rd=2, 6th=4, 9th=8
Minutes - 0 minute on analog=1, 10th=2, 20th=4, 30th=8, 40th=16, 50th=32

On both, a central (red) supergiant is a PM indicator.

Additional configuration options to display a large comet in foreground and to vibrate if bluetooth connection lost.   Requires Pebble firmware 3.10 or later.

Screenshots: 
  7:31AM (easy)
  9:09PM (easy)
  7:31AM (hard)
12:59PM (hard, BT connection lost)
  3:59PM (easy with Quick View)


Design & Programming Copyright ¬© 2016 Nev Rawlins

latest_release.release_notes: Added support for Pebble firmware V4, Pebble 2 and Quick Views

data.title: Binary Stars

data.description:
Update (Jan 26, 2016) : Improved settings page, Setting for hourly vibrations, Fixed BT indicator color.

Update (Jan 9, 2016) : Now choose your own colors for text and background. Head over to "App Setting" page to make your watchface show YOUR colors.

The clean and simple watch-face "Battery Clock", now with colors!! 

This time includes App-Setting page to choose from 15+ themes (Themes added regularly).

Features:
Giving you all the information you need in a glance. 
Shows : - Time (12h/24h depending on system setting) 
* Full/Abv. Month of the year (space permitted) 
* Day of the month 
* Full/Abv. Day of the week (space permitted) 
* Bluetooth disconnect indicator. Short pulse vibration for Bluetooth dis-connection. 
And as the name suggests : 
* Battery status (Shows the charge left. Also shows remaining charge percent and "Charging.." when plugged in). When battery level drops to 10% it will say "Charge me!" on the battery bar.
* Bettery bar color : 
Red when less than 10%
Yellow when less than 50%
Green when greater than 50%

Update 1.1:
* Improved settings page.
* Added option for hourly vibrations.
* Fixed BT disconnect indicator color issue.

data.author: Dylan Carpinelli

changelog.release_notes:
Previously, the newest version of IngressFace was v3.4. However, after returning to this code with more experience (and hindsight), I have determined that the watchface was poorly versioned. After cleaning up the code and ensuring everything works, I have determined that it should be reset to 1.0 to indicate that this version and this one only should be used. Future releases may be released to, for example, add support for the Pebble 2. In such a case, the version will only increase to v1.1 instead of jumping to v2.0 like I did back in February of 2016 after merely merging the Aplite and Basalt watchfaces into one. It did not justify creating an entirely new watchface starting at v2.0, meaning the original v1.0 can no longer be found. On top of this, when I fixed a major bug and considered it "stable", I incremented it to v3.0, which still did not make much sense.  

Please see this v1.0 release as a way to remedy confusion. Yes, it will mostly be erasing the past releases, but those can all still be viewed in commits. I should have only released this at v1.0 when I knew for a fact that it was stable.  

Thank you for your time and your patience. I apologise for any inconvenience.

data.description:
The Ingress-inspired watchface for the Pebble and Pebble Steel.

An agent's best friend! Always available on their wrist can be the most simple and essential of information one might need when going Ingressing. Maybe you just want to show your faction's colours, and be proud of where you belong. Either way, IngressFace can let you do it.

If you have never heard of Ingress, you should really check it out. It's augmented-reality at its finest! Anyone can play!

Features:
- Current time
- Current date
- Next checkpoint in localtime
- Displayed battery percentage
- Choice between date formats and/or use of a seconds ticker
- Colour/icon schemes according to your chosen faction
- Choice between countdown or simple time display for next checkpoint

The watchface doesn't require any sort of connection to a phone (except for the first-time set up and when the user moves between timezones; the Pebble will need to connect to the phone to determine a new timezone). This is essential for Ingress agents all over the world when they travel to those lacking-in-signal places that we all know too much about. Each checkpoint is calculated locally and by the watch itself.

Credit for the icon loaded in the bottom right corner of the watchface goes to cr0ybot and their fantastic skills. Very high-quality and large versions of all sorts of Ingress logos can be found on their GitHub (https://github.com/cr0ybot/ingress-logos). The icon used in this watchface is a modification of cr0ybot's.

latest_release.release_notes:
Previously, the newest version of IngressFace was v3.4. However, after returning to this code with more experience (and hindsight), I have determined that the watchface was poorly versioned. After cleaning up the code and ensuring everything works, I have determined that it should be reset to 1.0 to indicate that this version and this one only should be used. Future releases may be released to, for example, add support for the Pebble 2. In such a case, the version will only increase to v1.1 instead of jumping to v2.0 like I did back in February of 2016 after merely merging the Aplite and Basalt watchfaces into one. It did not justify creating an entirely new watchface starting at v2.0, meaning the original v1.0 can no longer be found. On top of this, when I fixed a major bug and considered it "stable", I incremented it to v3.0, which still did not make much sense.  

Please see this v1.0 release as a way to remedy confusion. Yes, it will mostly be erasing the past releases, but those can all still be viewed in commits. I should have only released this at v1.0 when I knew for a fact that it was stable.  

Thank you for your time and your patience. I apologise for any inconvenience.

data.title: IngressFace

data.description:
Vibrawatch is a watchface for the blind or visually impaired.  

Vibrawatch tells the time.  That's it.  It is designed to aid the blind or visually impaired - for whom specialist watches can be quite expensive and even then don't have the additional capabilities of smartwatches (eg, fitness tracking). 

Vibrawatch works in two ways:
Firstly, the watch uses as large a time display as will fit on the watch.  To do this we've split the hours and minutes display - every 10 seconds you get 3 seconds of the hour, and 7 seconds of the minute displayed.

Secondly, the two (or more) flicks of the wrist will set of the vibration system.  This encodes the time using vibrating pulses - a long pulse for 5 and short pulses for 1s, with gaps between the hours, tens of minutes and minute vibrations.  If the digit is a zero then the system sets of a longer modulated vibration.  Sounds complicated, but you get the hang of it fairly quickly!

In addition, the watch-face has a thick horizontal bar below the hours display - this serves as indication that the face is displaying hours and also shows the battery level.

Dolaugu Ltd is an R&D company based in Berkshire, UK, with a section dedicated to solutions for those fully capable of living alone, but who need that little extra help (eg, see www.notcheckingup.com).  Vibrawatch was developed over Christmas 2015 as an internal training project, and released when we realised it was actually quite useful!

latest_release.release_notes: Initial commit

data.title: Vibrawatch

This is the first EVER Custom navi to be built with the NEW Navi Engine 2.8, 
He scoffs at megaman and his measly 100HP, while he boasts his massive 1,000HP! (HP = your battery life with an extra '0', so 1000= 100%, 600=60% 200=20% etc, when the battery is low, the text will turn red, so you will not get 100HP and 100% confused)

This is mainly made to show off the new open source navi engine 2.8,
If you want to make your own navi with no programming required check out the tutorial!

data.description: A simple watchface featuring big, clear, handsome numerals. Use the configuration page to select colors.

latest_release.release_notes: Recompiled with SDK v4 to support Pebble 2 series.

data.title: BIG again

data.author: BV Designs

changelog.release_notes: Version 2.61:  Now available for Pebble Time 2!
Version 2.60: Now available for Pebble 2!!

Version 2.0: NEW features added! 
- New-look configuration page 
- Improved look and visibility 
- Option to change date formats (UK & US style) 
- Option to vibrate when disconnected
- Invert option now only shows in Classic Pebble and Pebble Steel 
- Date displays the language chosen in user settings

The most delicious watchface you've ever seen!! Watchface displays a pie, with the missing slice representing the current time in analogue format. The remaining piece shows the battery level, digital time, date and AM/PM respectively (if 12 hour). This display will show up in different places on the face depending on the time, showing as much detail as possible. The colours are not customisable, but the when the Bluetooth is disconnected the pie disappears and only the time, battery and date will show (white on black). In the configuration menu, the clock can only be updated every minute if desired to save battery. Also the screen invert can be turned on and off for Classic Pebble/Pebble Steel users. Enjoy, and send a heart if you do!!

data.description:
Now available for Pebble 2 and Pebble Time 2!!
--------------------------------------------------------------------Version 2.0: NEW features added!
- New-look configuration page
- Improved look and visibility
- Option to change date formats (UK & US style) 
- Option to vibrate when disconnected
- Invert option now only shows in Classic Pebble and Pebble Steel
- Date displays the language chosen in user settings

-----------------------------------------------------------------

The most delicious watchface you've ever seen!!

Watchface displays a pie, with the missing slice representing the current time in analogue format.  The remaining piece shows the battery level, digital time, date and AM/PM respectively (if 12 hour).  This display will show up in different places on the face depending on the time, showing as much detail as possible.

The colours are not customisable, but when the Bluetooth is disconnected the pie disappears and only the time, battery and date will show (white on black).  Vibrates with each connection status.

In the configuration menu, the clock can only be updated every minute if desired to save battery. Also the screen invert can be turned on and off for Classic Pebble/Pebble Steel users.

Enjoy, and send a heart if you do!!

latest_release.release_notes: Version 2.61:  Now available for Pebble Time 2!

data.title: PieWatch

data.description:
A simple countdown to the New Year.

Annum counts down to New Year's Eve. When the countdown finishes, the watch vibrates. Cheers!
